This game will seem quite fun at first.  And then, you'll start to get frustrated with various aspects of the game, no matter what role you play.  But, you'll keep playing.  Then, slowly, they'll start to change the version of the game that you grew to like, and you'll feel frustrated, but hopeful, that they'll make appropriate changes, because, of course they will.  But they won't.  And everything will intensify.  And when you're done spending your cash on cosmetics and dlc...you'll end up with nothing to show for it except some amazingly toxic individuals you'll come across who will say horrible things to you.  But don't worry, they won't get banned for it.

This game is very good, no horror horror (even if I meet a killer, yes that's how it screams). And yes I have given a rating of 9/10, this game is not too bad for me and also worthy of a paid game.

They asked me if I would recommend this game and the answer is no. Desync happen a lot in this game. you press a key and the action doesn't happen or it take a moment to happen which lead to multiple attempt for one action. Try healing a teammate and you know what I am talking about. Worst is dead hard where you can press the key and it won't come out and yeah your eating a hit. So on top of this and the Dev introducing new things into the game but it add more bugs into the game instead of fixing the problem just covering it. 

At this point I know that i'm just in a abusive relationship with Dead by daylight but I got no where else to go. learn from my mistake.

Since i'm almost reaching 2k hours into the game, might as well write a review for it.

I may not speak for the community itself but from my experience, you should give this game a try and maybe put a day or so to get a hang of it. 
The first few hours will make you want to refund this game after all the camping and tunneling or if you're playing Killer, teabagging and toxic SWF (survive with friends). It really is frustrated getting your ass whooped for the first time and to be frank you'll still get it whooped for the next few weeks or so. 
But once you have gotten a grip of it, the experience is very exhilarating and cathartic. I can still remember when i first looped a high rank killer for 5 gens or when I demolished a group of toxic SWF at red rank. Those moments were better like having your first orgasm, no kidding. 
This game may not be for anyone, since an asymmetrical game can feel very one sided at times  but with enough time and practice you'll start to enjoy it.

So, who should try this game?

Everyone. this game has quite a diverse fan-base and anyone can pick this up. If you're a horror fan then you should really give it a try since the Dev always experimenting with new concepts (Not saying they're all good, but still a breath of fresh air to the horror genre) and still trying to keep the essence of OG horror troops. You can find fan favorite classic Killers from Halloween - Micheal Myers, Texas Chainsaw - Leatherface, Scream - Ghostface, Saw - Jigsaw (Amanda Young version) and Nightmare on Elm street - Freddy Krueger. Or character from renown horror Game such as Bill from the Left for Dead series, Pyramid Head from Silent Hills and the latest entry, Nemesis from Resident Evil. The thrill and excitement you get from being chased by one of those killers is like riding a roller coaster.
If you're not a fan of horror then that's okay, apart from the Mori (a form of execution that is unique to each killer) the game is not gory in any shape or form. This game relies more on the surprise factors and build up tensions that you get from audio cues, music, visual cues... which makes you always have to be on high alert.

The perk system of the game gives the player the opportunity to personalize your play-styles. You can go for a Stealth build if you want to avoid confrontation, an Objective build that boost your Generator repairing  progress or the Confrontation build to make times for your team-mates. Not just for survivors only, Killers van also personalized their builds to work well with their powers and add-ons (Enhancement for you killer's power). 

Speaking of personalization, the cosmetic mechanic of this game is one the few best so far. I'm not saying they're exceptionally well done in concept or prosecution, the ability to mix and match pieces of any outfits gives the character personalities and makes you feel more connected to the character. Though i have to admit, the Idea of Unswappable-Set is one of the few decisions that i cannot make sense of.

However, this game still have some issues that in desperate needs of adjustment.
Since DBD has no competition on the market right now, the amount of effort they've put into recent contents is not good. Especially when it comes to Event or the Community, fans are noticing that the love that they have put from the beginning has faded. The Hallow Blight, Lunar and Summer BBQ event had been replaced by Bloodpoint offerings and a few recolors of existing cosmetics. 
There are a few more issues that i would love to address but if you're new to the game, you don't have to worry about them for now. 

My recommendation? 
If you have the game already then cool, give it a week or so to see if you should invest your time in it. 
As for newcomers, the price is reasonable for the experiences you're getting but you should wait for discounts just to maximize the value you'll get from the game. This game goes on sales every couple of months so be sure not to miss it

Anyway, hope to see new faces in the fog and remember...
